dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 729 IH: Emancipation Statue Removal Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Norton (for herself, Mr. Huffman, Ms. Clarke of New York, Mr. Blumenauer, Mr. Green of Texas, Mr. McGovern, and Mr. Grijalva) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To require the Secretary of the Interior to remove the Emancipation Memorial from Lincoln Park in the District of Columbia, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Emancipation Statue Removal Act.

subsection.text: The Secretary of the Interior shall remove the Emancipation Memorial from Lincoln Park in the District of Columbia.

The Secretary shall donate the Emancipation Memorial to a museum or other similar entity. The recipient of the Emancipation Memorial may not store, display, or exhibit the Emancipation Memorial outside. If the Emancipation Memorial is stored, displayed, or exhibited outside, ownership of the Emancipation Memorial will revert back to the Federal Government.
